segments.en: Hello everyone, welcome back to EnglishPod.
And we're bringing you the third part of our suspend series of New Guy in Town.
segments.cn: 我们带来的是《新来的家伙》系列的第三部分。

segments.en: Well, I don't know, there's still so many things that could happen.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不知道，还有很多事情可能发生。

segments.en: This guy is kind of weird, right?
segments.cn: 这个家伙有点奇怪，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and I would like to thank all of our listeners for contributing and sending out their ideas of what they think happens in this third part.
segments.cn: 是的，我想感谢所有听众的贡献和他们对第三部分的想法。

segments.en: Yeah, I especially like the story about the rabbit.
segments.cn: 是的，我特别喜欢关于兔子的故事。

segments.en: As promised, we took the idea of one of our listeners and created the dialogue around it.
segments.cn: 我们按照一位听众的想法创作了对话。

segments.en: And this time it was a contribution of Babar Dawan.
Yeah, he gave us a great idea for this dialogue.
segments.cn: 是的，他给了我们一个很好的对话创意。

segments.en: Exactly, he gave us a really good idea.
segments.cn: 确实，他给了我们一个很好的主意。

segments.en: And this one is for you.
In this dialogue, we're going to be looking at some hospitality vocabulary.
segments.cn: 在这个对话中，我们将学习一些款待相关的词汇。

segments.en: Yeah, some phrases you can use when you welcome someone to your house.
segments.cn: 是的，一些你可以在欢迎客人时使用的短语。

segments.en: Alright, well, we've got some language to preview.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有一些语言要预览。

segments.en: So let's turn now to vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 现在让我们来看看词汇预览。

segments.en: On vocabulary preview, we have the word appetite.
segments.cn: 在词汇预览中，我们有“食欲”这个词。

segments.en: So Erica, tell us about appetite.
segments.cn: 所以Erica，告诉我们关于食欲的事。

segments.en: When you have an appetite, you're hungry, or you have a desire to eat food, right?
segments.cn: 当你有食欲时，你是饿了，或者想吃东西，对吧？

segments.en: Alright, so you can have a big appetite, a small appetite.
segments.cn: 好吧，你可以有很大的食欲，也可以有小的食欲。

segments.en: Really hungry, a little bit hungry.
Okay, let's look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看下一个词。

segments.en: Poison could be a noun or a verb.
segments.cn: 毒药可以是名词或动词。

segments.en: So when you poison someone, you put something in their food or maybe in their drink that makes them really sick and maybe even makes them die.
segments.cn: 当你毒害某人时，你在他们的食物或饮料中放入某种东西，使他们非常生病，甚至可能致死。

segments.en: And the noun is actually the thing that you put inside the food or drink.
segments.cn: 名词实际上是你放入食物或饮料中的东西。

segments.en: So usually poison is some sort of chemical substance.
segments.cn: 所以通常毒药是一种化学物质。

segments.en: So if you get bitten by a snake, you'll get poisoned.
segments.cn: 所以如果你被蛇咬了，你会中毒。

segments.en: Alright, so let's take a look at our dialogue for the first time and see why we are talking about poison.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们第一次看看我们的对话，看看为什么我们在谈论毒药。

segments.en: And we'll come back and explain some great words.
segments.cn: 然后我们会回来解释一些很好的词汇。

segments.en: I hope you brought your appetite.
Oh, you have such good taste, Armand.
I'm thinking of redecorating my house.
segments.cn: 我在考虑重新装修我的房子。

segments.en: Maybe you could give me a few pointers.
segments.cn: 也许你可以给我一些建议。

segments.en: Can I offer you a glass of wine?
A very special Merlot brought directly from my home country.
segments.cn: 一种非常特别的梅洛，直接从我的祖国带来的。

segments.en: It has a unique ingredient, which gives it a pleasant aroma and a superior flavor.
segments.cn: 它有一种独特的成分，赋予它愉悦的香气和卓越的风味。

segments.en: It's a bit bitter for my taste.
I hope you didn't poison her drink too much.
segments.cn: 我希望你没有把她的饮料毒得太厉害。

segments.en: Alright, well, I really wonder what's going to happen next.
segments.cn: 好吧，我真的很想知道接下来会发生什么。
我们看看接下来会发生什么。

segments.en: But now, let's take a look at some of the language in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 但现在，让我们看看语言要点中的一些语言。

segments.en: Alright, so we have a couple of words in Language Takeaway today.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的语言要点中有几个词。

segments.en: So to give somebody pointers... You give them some suggestions.
segments.cn: 所以给某人建议……你给他们一些建议。
好的，有什么建议或提示。

segments.en: Let's listen to some examples of how you would use it.
segments.cn: 让我们听听一些你会如何使用它的例子。

segments.en: I want to dance salsa better.
segments.cn: 我想更好地跳萨尔萨舞。

segments.en: Can you give me a few pointers?
I need some pointers on how to be a better manager.
segments.cn: 我需要一些关于如何成为更好经理的建议。

segments.en: Let me give you a few pointers so you can pass your exam.
segments.cn: 让我给你一些建议，这样你就能通过考试。

segments.en: Let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 让我们看看下一个单词。

segments.en: This is a nice round word, isn't it?
segments.cn: 这是一个好听的圆润词，不是吗？

segments.en: Well, this word makes you sound really educated.
segments.cn: 嗯，这个词让你听起来很有文化。
基本上，它的意思是……气味。

segments.en: So you could say, for example, this coffee has a great aroma.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，例如，这咖啡有很好的香气。

segments.en: Or maybe this perfume has the aroma of roses and lavender.
segments.cn: 或者这个香水有玫瑰和薰衣草的香气。

segments.en: Okay, let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看下一个单词。

segments.en: So bitter is the opposite of... Sweet.
So it's always hard to describe taste, isn't it?
segments.cn: 所以描述味道总是很难，不是吗？

segments.en: But maybe we can say a few foods that are bitter.
segments.cn: 但也许我们可以说一些苦的食物。

segments.en: So chocolate, when it has no sugar, is bitter.
segments.cn: 所以没有糖的巧克力是苦的。

segments.en: Or, for example, coffee without any sugar is also bitter.
segments.cn: 或者，例如，没有糖的咖啡也是苦的。

segments.en: And sometimes red wine can be quite bitter.
Okay, and now let's take a look at our last word.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看最后一个单词。

segments.en: Yeah, when you put them together.
segments.cn: 是的，当你把它们放在一起时。

segments.en: It means fate or become unconscious.
segments.cn: 它的意思是失去知觉或昏迷。

segments.en: So imagine someone, when, you know, they're standing up and then suddenly they start to move around and then fall over to the ground.
segments.cn: 所以想象一下，有人站着，然后突然开始晃动，然后倒在地上。

segments.en: This usually happens when you get really, really drunk.
segments.cn: 这通常发生在你喝得酩酊大醉的时候。

segments.en: Maybe sometimes also when maybe you're pregnant, you might pass out.
segments.cn: 也许有时当你怀孕时，你也可能会昏倒。

segments.en: Marco and I have a couple of examples of this word for you.
segments.cn: 马尔科和我有几个这个词的例子给你。

segments.en: I drank so much last night that I passed out at my friend's house.
segments.cn: 我昨晚喝了太多酒，以至于在朋友家昏倒了。

segments.en: She was standing in the sun too long, so she passed out right in front of me.
segments.cn: 她在阳光下站得太久，所以就在我面前昏倒了。

segments.en: My sister passes out whenever she sees blood.
segments.cn: 我姐姐每次看到血就会昏倒。

segments.en: Alright, so let's listen to our dialogue again now.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: We're going to slow it down a little bit and you'll be able to hear these words that we just talked about.
segments.cn: 我们会慢一点，你将能听到我们刚刚讨论的这些词。

segments.en: I hope you brought your appetite.
You have such good taste, Armand.
I'm thinking of redecorating my house.
segments.cn: 我在考虑重新装修我的房子。

segments.en: Maybe you could give me a few pointers?
segments.cn: 也许你可以给我一些建议？

segments.en: Can I offer you a glass of wine?
A very special Merlot brought directly from my home country.
segments.cn: 一种非常特别的梅洛，直接从我的祖国带来的。

segments.en: It has a unique ingredient, which gives it a pleasant aroma and superior flavor.
segments.cn: 它有一种独特的成分，赋予它愉悦的香气和卓越的风味。

segments.en: It's a bit bitter for my taste.
I hope that you didn't poison her drink too much.
segments.cn: 我希望你没有把她的饮料下毒太多。

segments.en: We have some great phrases that we've used here, so let's take a look at them in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们这里有一些很好的短语，所以让我们在流利构建器中看看它们。

segments.en: We've got four phrases for you that are great to use when you want to welcome someone into your house, or into your office, or anywhere, really.
segments.cn: 我们有四个短语，适合在你想欢迎某人到你家、办公室或任何地方时使用。

segments.en: So, why don't we take a look at the first one.
segments.cn: 那么，为什么我们不看看第一个呢。

segments.en: So this is a very common phrase when you invite somebody to your house.
segments.cn: 这是邀请某人到你家时非常常见的短语。

segments.en: It's like, make yourself comfortable, relax, sit down.
segments.cn: 就是，让自己舒适，放松，坐下。

segments.en: Like, my house is your house.
segments.cn: 就是，我的家就是你的家。

segments.en: Usually people arrive to a party or to a dinner with jackets, coats, scarves, all that stuff.
segments.cn: 通常人们到派对或晚餐时会穿着夹克、外套、围巾等等。

segments.en: So, this next phrase is really handy.
segments.cn: 所以，下一个短语非常实用。

segments.en: So that means, give me your coats and I'll put them in the closet.
segments.cn: 这意味着，把你的外套给我，我会把它们放进衣柜里。

segments.en: And then, a good host would always offer a drink, right?
segments.cn: 然后，一个好的主人总是会提供饮料，对吧？

segments.en: Water, or in this case, wine.
segments.cn: 水，或者在这种情况下，红酒。

segments.en: So, they would say, can I offer you a glass of wine?
segments.cn: 所以，他们会说，我可以给你一杯红酒吗？

segments.en: Or sometimes you could say, can I offer you a glass, can I offer you something to drink?
segments.cn: 或者有时你可以说，我可以给你一杯，我可以给你点饮料吗？

segments.en: So, can I offer you a glass of wine?
segments.cn: 所以，我可以给你一杯红酒吗？

segments.en: Can I offer you a glass of wine?
segments.cn: 我可以给你一杯红酒吗？

segments.en: You offer me a glass of wine, I say, yeah, sure, I'll take a glass of wine.
segments.cn: 你给我一杯红酒，我说，好的，我会喝一杯红酒。

segments.en: Alright, and then I would use our next phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，然后我会使用下一个短语。

segments.en: It doesn't mean that you are here.
segments.cn: 这并不意味着你在这里。

segments.en: It's saying to someone, here it is, take it.
segments.cn: 这是对某人说，给你，拿去。

segments.en: This is a really, really great phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常非常好的短语。

segments.en: A lot of people who are learning English don't say this, but it's really common, really natural.
segments.cn: 很多学习英语的人不说这个，但它真的很常见，非常自然。

segments.en: And if you use it, you'll sound really great.
segments.cn: 如果你使用它，你会听起来很棒。

segments.en: You can use this anytime you give someone something.
segments.cn: 你可以在任何时候给某人东西时使用这个。

segments.en: So, if you give somebody a pen or a pencil, a notebook, here you are.
segments.cn: 所以，如果你给某人一支笔或铅笔、一个笔记本，给你。

segments.en: So, let's listen to our dialogue one more time, and then we'll come back.
segments.cn: 所以，让我们再听一遍我们的对话，然后我们再回来。

segments.en: I hope you brought your appetite.
Oh, you have such good taste, Armand.
segments.cn: 哦，你的品味真好，阿尔芒。

segments.en: I'm thinking of redecorating my house.
segments.cn: 我在考虑重新装修我的房子。

segments.en: Maybe you could give me a few pointers?
segments.cn: 也许你可以给我一些建议？

segments.en: Can I offer you a glass of wine?
segments.cn: 我可以给你一杯红酒吗？

segments.en: A very special Merlot, brought directly from my home country.
segments.cn: 一种非常特别的梅洛，直接从我的祖国带来的。

segments.en: It has a unique ingredient, which gives it a pleasant aroma and a superior flavor.
segments.cn: 它有一种独特的成分，赋予它愉悦的香气和卓越的风味。

segments.en: It's a bit bitter for my taste.
I hope you didn't poison her drink too much.
segments.cn: 我希望你没有把她的饮料下毒太多。

segments.en: Okay, so Armand is a pretty good host.
segments.cn: 好吧，阿尔芒是个不错的主人。

segments.en: Yeah, which is a type of wine.
And this is really interesting because there are many types of wines.
segments.cn: 这真的很有趣，因为有很多种葡萄酒。

segments.en: Alright, so give us some pointers here.
segments.cn: 好吧，给我们一些建议吧。

segments.en: Alright, Merlot is probably the most common red wine, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，梅洛可能是最常见的红酒，对吧？

segments.en: And Merlot is actually the grape variety.
segments.cn: 而梅洛实际上是葡萄品种。

segments.en: Varietal, as it's called in wine-speak.
segments.cn: 在葡萄酒术语中称为品种。

segments.en: Yeah, well right now I'm really liking to drink Tempranillo, which is a Spanish wine.
segments.cn: 是的，现在我真的很喜欢喝坦普拉尼洛，这是一种西班牙酒。

segments.en: And that is that also the type of grape?
Usually we would say red wine or white wine, right?
segments.cn: 通常我们会说红酒或白酒，对吧？

segments.en: But the varieties, depending on the grapes, is what gives them their names.
segments.cn: 但品种根据葡萄而定，这就是它们的名字。

segments.en: So we also have a couple of other, like maybe you have a Chardonnay.
segments.cn: 所以我们还有其他几种，比如你可能有霞多丽。

segments.en: Yeah, and my personal favorite is a Carminare.
segments.cn: 是的，我个人最喜欢的是卡门内尔。

segments.en: Oh, yeah, that's a nice wine.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，那是一款不错的酒。

segments.en: Yeah, and it's not very common anymore.
segments.cn: 是的，而且现在不太常见了。

segments.en: Apparently the grape isn't growing very well in France anymore or in Spain.
segments.cn: 显然这种葡萄在法国或西班牙生长得不好。

segments.en: So from what I understand, it's only in Chile and Argentina.
segments.cn: 所以我了解到，它只在智利和阿根廷。

segments.en: Actually, Argentina makes really good Carminares.
segments.cn: 事实上，阿根廷的卡门内尔做得很好。

segments.en: But you know who else makes good wine?
segments.cn: 但你知道谁还做得好酒吗？

segments.en: Yeah, you almost never find it outside of Canada, but there is one region in the western part of the country that makes really, really good wines, especially some nice Pinot noirs and some good white wines.
segments.cn: 是的，你几乎在加拿大以外找不到，但在这个国家的西部有一个地区，那里生产非常好的酒，尤其是一些不错的黑比诺和一些好的白酒。

segments.en: Well, what about in your countries?
Do you produce any wine or maybe any other type of drink?
segments.cn: 你们生产酒或其他饮料吗？

segments.en: Many countries have their own types of drinks, so we want to know about it.
segments.cn: 许多国家都有自己的饮品，所以我们想了解一下。

segments.en: And many countries have different traditions to be hospitable, to be welcoming.
segments.cn: 许多国家有不同的传统来款待和欢迎客人。

segments.en: Yeah, so visit our website EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 是的，访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Tell us about how you welcome people into your house.
segments.cn: 告诉我们你是如何欢迎客人到你家里的。

segments.en: All right, and we'll be there to answer them, but we gotta go now, so... Until next time, bye!
segments.cn: 好吧，我们会在那里回答，但我们现在得走了，所以……下次见，再见！
